ca.mcgill.ecse211.finalproject

Class Navigation

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.finalproject.Navigation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    UltrasonicController

    public class Navigation
extends java.lang.Object
implements UltrasonicController
    This class is used to drive the robot on the demo floor. It contains all methods pertinent to the motors, as well as a light correction method
    Author:
    Anthony Laye, Mai Zeng

    • Method Detail

      • travelTo

        public void travelTo(double x,
            double y,
            boolean immediateReturn)
        This method is meant to drive the robot to the predefined waypoints, user must enter if we wait for the robot to finish moving before return from the method
        Parameters:
        x - : x value to travel to
        y - : y value to travel to
        immediateReturn - : True if the function is to be instantly returned. False if the function is to be returned after the travel is completed

      • turnTo

        public void turnTo(double minimalT,
          double original)
        This method instructs the robot to rotate to a certain angle, with respect to its current angle as measured by the odometer
        Parameters:
        minimalT - : minimal angle to turn
        original - : original angle on odometer

      • rotateTheRobot

        public void rotateTheRobot(boolean clockWise,
                  double angleToRotate,
                  boolean blocked)
        This method is created to let the robot rotate an absolute angle
        Parameters:
        clockWise - : direction to rotate robot
        angleToRotate - : absolute angle to rotate robot
        blocked - : True if the function is to be instantly returned. False if the function is to be returned after the travel is completed

      • stopMotors

        public void stopMotors()
        This method is to stop both left and right motors

      • advanceRobot

        public void advanceRobot(double distanceToTravel,
                boolean immediateReturn)
        Advances the robot a desired amount of cm.
        Parameters:
        distanceToTravel - Distance to travel in cm.
        immediateReturn - True if the function is to be instantly returned. False if the function is to be returned after the travel is completed.

      • isNavigating

        public boolean isNavigating()
        Returns if the robot is navigating or not
        Returns:

      • lightCorrect

        public void lightCorrect()
        This method implements light correction to be done while the robot is navigating. It is mostly used for the tree and tunnel, as well as initial light localization. While a wheel is moving, we check to see if either one sees a line. When this is the case the wheel stops and waits for the other to see the line.

      • tunnelLocalize

        public void tunnelLocalize(double angle1,
                  double angle2,
                  double x,
                  double y,
                  boolean isVertical)
        This method takes in 5 arguments to allow the robot to drive in a specified direction, detect lines, and correct the odometer respectively.
        Parameters:
        angle1 - : the first angle to turn to to begin light localization
        angle2 - : the second angle to turn to to begin light localization
        x - : the x value to correct to once we reach an x grid line
        y - : the y value to correct to once we reach a y grid line
        isVertical - : boolean to check if tunnel is vertical or horizontal

      • convertDistance

        public static int convertDistance(double radius,
                  double travelDistance)
        This method allows the conversion of a distance to the total rotation of each wheel need to cover that distance.
        Parameters:
        radius - : radius of wheel
        distance - : distance to travel
        Returns:
